column37: View Tips: For more space on your screen, please minimize the ribbon by clicking on the "^" on the top right-hand corner of your screen or zoom out using the view controls on the bottom-right hand corner of your screen.

column1: Welcome to Financial Modeling and Valuation Step 5 of 7!
column2: The Cash Flow Statement Forecasts are mainly from the Balance Sheet (i.e., 'working capital', capex, debt and equity) and the Income Statement (net income and depreciation).

column1: Nothing to do here! Please move on to Step 6 on the next tab.
Orange Shaded Cells = Sparklines (for trend analysis)
column37: Note from Chris: Please make sure to close the groups by clicking on "1" to the left and slightly above column A or you will see quarterly numbers in this sparkline column.

column1: Green = links to data from another tab
Does $ from Our Balance Sheet reflected in our $ here?
Free Cash Flow (this is Net Cash from Operating Activities - Capex)
Next Step: Please click on the tab called Step 6 DCF Valuation (or use the buttons at the top). Please remember to only change blue shaded text. Thanks
